definitions.definition: a very small amount of something:
examples: There's still a shred of hope that a peace agreement can be reached.

definitions.definition: to cut or tear something roughly into thin strips:
examples: Shred the lettuce and arrange it around the edge of the dish.

definitions.definition: to destroy a document by tearing it into strips, especially in a machine:
examples: He ordered his secretary to shred important documents when government inspectors started investigating his business affairs.
